column1: It uses a radioactive substance (called a tracer) to look for disease in the lungs such as lung cancer.
The tracer is given through a vein (IV), usually on the inside of your elbow.
The tracer helps the doctor (radiologist) see certain areas or diseases more clearly.
Most PET scans are now performed along with a CT scan.
A PET scan causes no pain.

This test may be done to: - Help diagnose lung cancer - See if lung cancer has spread to other areas of the body - Help determine if a growth in the lungs (seen on a CT scan) is cancerous or not - Determine how well cancer treatment is working

Abnormal results may be due to: - Infection - Inflammation of the lungs due to other causes - Lung cancer or cancer of another area of the body that has spread to the lungs - Solitary pulmonary nodule Blood sugar or insulin level may affect the test results in people with diabetes.
Some people have pain, redness, or swelling at the injection site.
